TopicTitle: PS4 Save game corrupted, restored, now won't load

Articles.Content:
I quit playing this game a few years ago because it kept corrupting my save files after many hours of work, thus crushing my soul. I saw the update implemented a new scheme for restoring the corrupted save files so I gave it another try. It seemed to be working after the first few crashes and restored save games, so I started investing some energy in it again. I even bought the expansion content.

Now it has decided it won't load my career save file. The default and sandbox saves load just fine, but when I try to load the one I actually care about the game just happily returns to the main menu like I didn't select anything. So now it seems I've lost my game all over again. Is there any way to get my career save file back without restoring from some other version?

I posted this same advice elsewhere recently too but something similar happened to me and I was able to recover my game from the PS4 menu in Settings -> Application Save Data Management somewhere.  
 

Find KSP and get in there, find your game and it has an option to ‘restore from ‘ or something.  No guarantee it works for everyone and not sure why no one else seems to know to suggest this but if you have nothing else to lose, give it a whirl.  Hope that helps!
you have a external folder with your kerbal world? or, if you saved your world in online archivie you should find him with clicking Option in the app and click “download load online”
